thread.title: Here's an early look at the System Shock reboot
thread.title_full: Here's an early look at the System Shock reboot

title: Here's an early look at the System Shock reboot
text:
Here's an early look at the System Shock reboot Through the looking glass. By Wesley Yin-Poole Published 02/03/2017 
Night Dive Studios has released a video showing an early look at the System Shock reboot. 
The video, below, shows off Unreal Engine 4-powered pre-alpha footage of the reboot, due out in 2018 on PC, PlayStation 4 and Xbox One. 
System Shock, developed by Looking Glass and released in 1994, is set aboard a space station in a cyberpunk vision of the year 2072. You play a nameless hacker who battles against a horrible artificial intelligence called SHODAN. 
System Shock was critically-acclaimed for its 3D engine and physics simulation, which went on to influence a raft of games. Looking Glass, with the help of Irrational Games, released a sequel in 1999. Games featured in this article
